question: Touchpad tips for your Chromebook
name: Touchpad tips for your Chromebook
fulltext:
Your Chromebook has an etched glass touchpad that is fully clickable. Here are some tips for using the touchpad.

Move the pointer: Simply move your finger across the touchpad.
Click: Just press down on the lower half of the touchpad. You can also quickly tap the touchpad to click if the tap-to-click option is enabled in your settings.
Right-click: Click the touchpad with two fingers.
Scroll: Place two fingers on the touchpad and move them up and down to scroll vertically, left and right to scroll horizontally. To reverse scrolling, enable simple scrolling by click on the Chrome menu and in the "Device" section, click on Pointer settings.
Drag and drop: Use one finger to click on an item. Use a second finger to move the item to your intended location. Release both fingers to drop.

Have other questions or need more help? Go online and visit the Help Center at www.google.com/support/chromeos.

question: Touch screen tips for your Chromebook Pixel
name: Touch screen tips for your Chromebook Pixel
fulltext:
Here are some tips for using the touch screen on your Chromebook Pixel.

Tap: Just tap the screen on the area you want to click
Double tap: To double-click, just tap the screen twice.
Long press: Touch and hold the area you want to right-click.
Drag: Move your finger up and down to scroll vertically, left and right to scroll horizontally.
Flick: Swipe your finger quickly to scroll fast or switch between pages.
Flick: Swipe up from the bottom of your screen to show the launcher or swipe down to hide the launcher.

Have other questions or need more help? Go online and visit the Help Center at www.google.com/support/chromeos.

question: Keyboard features for your Chromebook Pixel
name: Keyboard features for your Chromebook Pixel
fulltext:
The keyboard on your Chromebook Pixel automatically lights up when you need it, and offers special web browsing key functions to help you quickly find what you need on the web. You can also choose to show the full keyboard on your Chromebook's high-resolution display.

Shortcut keys

Go to the previous page in your browsing history
Go to the next page in your browsing history
Reload your current page
Maximize your window
Switch to your next window
Decrease screen brightness
Increase screen brightness
Mute
Decrease the volume
Increase the volume
Search the web from the address bar. Note: This key is located on the side, where you'd normally find the Caps Lock key.

Helpful keyboard shortcuts

We've listed just a few shortcuts here. To see a map of all available shortcuts, press Ctrl+Alt+?.

Page up Press Alt and the up arrow
Page down Press Alt and the down arrow
Home Press Ctrl+Alt, and the up arrow
End Press Ctrl+Alt, and the down arrow
Toggle the bookmark bar Ctrl+Shift+B
Search your current webpage Ctrl+F
Open a new tab Ctrl+T
Open a new window Ctrl+N
Open the link you clicked in a new background tab Press Ctrl and click a link
Switch to your next tab Ctrl+Tab
Switch to your next window Alt+Tab
Sign out of your Google Account Ctrl+Shift+Q
Close your current tab Ctrl+W

question: Charge your Chromebook Pixel
name: Charge your Chromebook Pixel
fulltext:
The battery on your Chromebook Pixel is designed to last for 5.5 hours of use, though battery life may vary based on usage and other conditions. To charge the battery, plug one end of the power adapter into the power port on the left side of your Chromebook and the other end into a power outlet.

When your Chromebook is plugged in, the charge indicator light indicates the status of your battery.

Green Your Chromebook is completely charged
Yellow Charging is in process
Red Charging error
No light Your Chromebook is not charging

See how much power is remaining

The power state indicator behind the display is a quick way to check how much power you have left. As you use your Chromebook, you can also click the battery icon in the lower-right corner of your screen to see how much power is remaining and how much time it’ll take to fully recharge the battery if your Chromebook is plugged into a power source. If you're running dangerously low on battery, you'll see a notification in the bottom right-hand corner of the screen.
